name: Mapo Tofu
description: A spicy and flavorful dish featuring soft tofu cubes cooked in a spicy, oily, and savory sauce with minced pork and fermented black beans.

name: Kung Pao Chicken
description: Stir-fried chicken with peanuts, vegetables, and chili peppers in a spicy and tangy sauce.

name: Sichuan Hot Pot
description: A communal cooking pot filled with a spicy and numbing broth, where diners cook a variety of ingredients like thinly sliced meat, vegetables, and noodles.

name: Shui Zhu Yu
description: A spicy fish dish featuring tender fish fillets poached in a fiery red chili oil broth with Sichuan peppercorns and vegetables.

name: Dan Dan Noodles
description: Noodles served in a spicy, savory sauce made with chili oil, Sichuan peppercorns, minced pork, and preserved vegetables, garnished with peanuts and scallions.

name: Peking Duck
description: A famous dish consisting of roasted duck with crispy skin, served with thin pancakes, hoisin sauce, and scallions.

name: Zhajiangmian
description: Noodles topped with a savory sauce made from ground pork or beef, fermented soybean paste, and fresh vegetables.

name: Jing Jiang Rou Si
description: Shredded pork stir-fried with a sweet bean sauce and julienne cucumbers, carrots, and other vegetables.

name: Douzhi
description: A fermented mung bean soup with a strong and unique flavor, often served with deep-fried dough sticks (youtiao).

name: Chaogan
description: Stir-fried pig liver with green peppers, onions, and bean sprouts, seasoned with soy sauce and other spices.

name: Xiaolongbao
description: Steamed soup dumplings filled with pork and a savory broth, a signature dish of Shanghai cuisine.

name: Shengjianbao
description: Pan-fried pork buns with a crispy bottom and juicy filling, often served with a flavorful dipping sauce.

name: Hong Shao Rou
description: Braised pork belly cooked in soy sauce, sugar, and spices until tender and flavorful.

name: Shanghai Fried Noodles
description: Stir-fried noodles with vegetables, pork, and a savory sauce, commonly found in Shanghai's local eateries.

name: Lion's Head Meatballs
description: Large pork meatballs cooked with cabbage and other ingredients in a savory sauce, named for their resemblance to lion heads.

name: Beef Noodle Soup
description: A hearty soup featuring tender beef, noodles, and vegetables in a rich, flavorful broth, often spiced with soy sauce, garlic, and spices.

name: Lu Rou Fan
description: Braised pork belly served over steamed rice, often topped with pickled vegetables and a boiled egg.

name: Gua Bao
description: Steamed buns filled with braised pork belly, pickled mustard greens, and ground peanuts, creating a flavorful and satisfying snack.

name: Oyster Omelette
description: A savory omelette made with fresh oysters, eggs, and a starchy batter, pan-fried until crispy and golden brown.

name: Stinky Tofu
description: Fermented tofu with a strong odor, deep-fried until crispy and served with pickled cabbage and chili sauce, beloved by many for its unique flavor.
